text: The 1919 Rose Bowl, known at the time as the Tournament East-West Football Game, was a bowl game played on January 1, 1919, at Tournament Park in Pasadena, California. It was the 5th Rose Bowl Game. With the war just over, the game was played with players from the Mare Island Marines of California and the Great Lakes Navy from Great Lakes, Illinois.Rose Bowl Game Timeline , Pasadena Tournament of Roses ==Teams== With college football teams depleted due to World War I, the Pasadena Tournament of Roses decided to stage the game with military personnel. With approval from President Woodrow Wilson, they invited the team from the Marine detachment at the Mare Island Naval Base for the second consecutive year, while it was the first appearance by a Navy team from the Naval Station Great Lakes. ===Scoring=== {| class="wikitable" |- ! Qtr. ! Team ! Scoring play ! Score |- |1 |style="text-align:center"|GL |Driscoll 30 yard FG |GL 3–0 |- |2 |style="text-align:center"|GL |Reeves 3 yard rush, Blalock kick good |GL 10–0 |- |3 |style="text-align:center"|GL |Halas 32 yard pass from Driscoll, Blalock kick good |GL 17–0 |- !colspan=4|Source: |} ==Game notes== Game MVP and future Pro Football Hall of Fame coach and Chicago Bears owner George “Papa Bear” Halas holds the Rose Bowl record for the longest non-scoring pass interception return of 77 yards. ==References== Rose Bowl Category:Rose Bowl Game Category:Military competitions in American football Category:1919 in sports in California Category:January 1919 sports events
title: 1919 Rose Bowl
